item.title: Easy, tasty and nutritious recipes for sharing this Ramadan
item.description: Looking for easy, nutritious Ramadan recipes? These options will help you prepare for and break your fast well.

item.title: Solo diver recounts brush with mako sharks off Tasmanian coast
item.description: Phillip Ellis Wells was solo diving roughly 7 kilometres off the east coast of Tasmania when he noticed a shadow pass overhead.

item.title: Innovative cattle loading ramp puts animal welfare at centre of design
item.description: A retired truck driver has developed a wide, steel, cattle-loading ramp that allows animals to walk side by side, mimicking natural herd behaviour and reducing noise, agitation and the risk of injury during transport.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Injured Australians return home from Games, skating union defends controversial scoring — quick hits from day seven
item.description: A petition to investigate the judging of the ice dance competition has been dismissed by the sport's governing body, as two injured Australians are forced home from the Games. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Scotty James left numb by the tragedy of 'almost' at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Scotty James has sought what resides at the end of the Olympic rainbow his whole career. But for the third time, he's had to settle for the numbing pain of almost being an Olympic champion.

item.title: Jane Hume was punished for her election slips. Now she's been crowned deputy Liberal leader
item.description: The Victorian senator was unceremoniously turfed from Sussan Ley's ministry after being tarred personally with much of what went wrong in the Coalition's cataclysmic loss. On Friday, she ascended to the Liberal's second-in-command.

item.title: Heat of summers gone by still fresh in the memory of 98yo Clarence 'Clack' John
item.description: Clarence "Clack" John has been through 98 summers in Renmark, South Australia. But as the town sweltered through its hottest recorded day last month, he remembers hot weather before records began.

item.title: Police appeal for help after 'priceless' Egyptian artefacts stolen from Caboolture museum north of Brisbane
item.description: An ancient burial mask, cat figurine and jewellery are among the "priceless" Egyptian artefacts stolen from the Abbey Museum of Art and Archaeology yesterday.

item.title: Australia and EU set to ink landmark free trade agreement
item.description: Australia and the European Union are on the cusp of finally reaching a free trade agreement after years of sometimes fraught negotiations.

item.title: Broome man had to wait for someone to die to access dialysis in his hometown
item.description: Kimberley resident David Lawford had to wait in Perth until someone in his hometown died before he could get access to dialysis on his return.

item.title: Coroner apologises for 'excruciating delay' in report on David Wood's tragic death in Antarctica
item.description: A decade after David Wood fell into a crevasse during a fuel drop in Antarctica, the ACT's chief coroner has handed down her findings into the Canadian helicopter pilot's death.

item.title: Roads, homes, cars damaged as Alice Springs starts flash flood clean-up
item.description: With Alice Springs homes, businesses and roads damaged by flash flooding this week, the government is facing pressure to improve local flood mitigation measures.

item.title: Former AFL captain Dyson Heppell speaks about unhealthy relationship with food during playing career
item.description: Former Essendon captain Dyson Heppell has spoken about the unhealthy relationship he had with food early in his career.

item.title: Pair who plotted Islamic State-inspired attack on Jews in UK jailed for life
item.description: A UK court jails two men for life for planning an Islamic State-inspired gun attack on a Jewish gathering in northern England.

item.title: Cam Bolton sent message of support to Josie Baff before she won gold at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: The injury-ravaged Australian snowboard cross team earned an enormous boost with Josie Baff's Winter Olympic gold medal, with injured teammate Cam Bolton urging his teammate to keep the faith.

item.title: Valentino Guseli thought he saw an 'omen from the shred gods' during the 2026 Winter Olympics halfpipe final
item.description: As Valentino Guseli watched his teammate Scotty James "tearing" the halfpipe apart, he thought an "omen from the shred gods" would deliver him an elusive Olympic gold medal.

item.title: WA Coroner finds 'cascade of events' responsible for heart attack death of man arrested at Perth Underground Station
item.description: A coronial inquest into the death of a 24-year-old man at a Perth train station finds the act of restraining him in a face-down position likely contributed to his death.

item.title: Wool price jumps ahead of industry-first Chinese New Year break
item.description: As wool growers enjoy their best prices since 2019, the market will now pause to respect China's request for a week off to celebrate Lunar New Year.

item.title: Chris Baghsarian, 85, kidnapped in reported case of mistaken identity in Sydney
item.description: Police make a rare appeal in what they say is the mistaken identity kidnapping of 85-year-old Chris Baghsarian in Sydney.

item.description: New Liberal Party leader Angus Taylor says restoring voter confidence in the Liberal party will be challenging.

item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Major construction starts on Adelaide's first skyscraper Festival Tower Two
item.description: Festival Tower Two is set to tower over South Australia's Parliament House, which the premier says will bring money and people into the city, but others remain against the $800 million project.

item.description: Law enforcement in Arizona is conducting activity related to the Nancy Guthrie case.

item.title: Carlton star taken to hospital as Victoria holds off WA in AFL Origin
item.description: Victoria holds off a spirited WA side to win the first Aussie rules State of Origin clash for 27 years, though the game is marred by a serious injury to Carlton star Jacob Weitering.

item.title: 'Freedom of memory': Ukrainian skier makes statement after helmet DQ
item.description: Ukrainian skier Kateryna Kotsar writes "freedom of memory" on her gloves in an apparent reference to compatriot Vladyslav Heraskevych's disqualification for wearing images of slain athletes on his helmet.

item.title: Laura Peel's Olympic journey ends before even stepping onto snow at 2026 Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Instead of the glint of gold, Laura Peel's lasting Olympic memory will be the glittering diamonds of despair in Zhangjiakou, with the 36-year-old ruled out of the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina after suffering a knee injury on the eve of the Games.

item.title: Jakara Anthony wins dual moguls gold at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Jakara Anthony achieves Winter Olympic redemption, claiming a stunning gold medal in the women's dual moguls.

item.title: Russia poisoned opposition leader Alexei Navalny, UK and allies say
item.description: Five European foreign ministers say analysis of samples from the former Russian opposition leader, who died two years ago, confirmed the presence of a toxin from poison frogs.

item.description: The paralysing uncertainty that weighed on the Liberals' faces has lifted for now, but morale in politics follows results rather than reshuffles.

item.description: I admire your courage for giving the quiz another go. Just kidding, I never feel that way.

item.description: Jakara Anthony stared down adversity, swallowed back her pain, and delivered a performance for the ages to become Australia's greatest Winter Olympian.

item.description: Pauline Hanson's One Nation has seen the fastest polling rise in modern Australian politics. What is going on?

item.description: Sophie Hyde's films have won awards at Sundance and Berlin, but she has more riding on her latest release. She's turned the lens on the long-held secrets of her unconventional family.

item.description: As Israel's security cabinet agreed on a plan that would pave the way for future settlements in the occupied West Bank, Palestinians say the pressure from Israeli settlers is relentless.

item.description: Long-term structural shifts have gravitational forces that are hard to escape, says a Westpac economist.

item.description: Rob Smethurst was in the throes of a four-day drunken bender when a friend called and told him his local football team was for sale. Now his tiny English club is making global headlines.

item.description: As Bree Walker aims to create Olympic history in the women's monobob, she will do so on a track named after a man who made history of his own through one of the Winter Games' most selfless acts.

item.description: A generation of children in South-East Asia are growing up without their mothers, who have to work abroad for decades to make ends meet.

item.description: Researchers say leptospirosis is emerging as a climate‑driven health threat in Australia, with frequent storms, floods and heatwaves pushing the disease further south.

item.description: The ACT Brumbies have turned up the heat to blitz the Western Force 56-24 in a sapping season-opening Super Rugby Pacific clash in Perth.

item.description: Rainfall was below average for most of Australia's south-east, far-west and central regions in the first month of the year.

item.title: How a pocket of Sydney's inner west went from Australia's deepest coal mine to waterfront houses
item.description: What was once a working class, coal-fuelled borough is now a sought-after suburb in Sydney's inner west, with houses selling for millions.

item.description: With fires and floods occurring simultaneously, and overlapping with international deployments, sharing critical resources is becoming an increasingly complex task.

item.title: Police block road near Nancy Guthrie's home during investigation into her disappearance
item.description: Authorities investigating the disappearance of American morning show host Savannah Guthrie's mother seal off a road near Nancy Guthrie's Arizona home.

item.title: Destanee Aiava announces retirement, calls out online trolls and 'racist' tennis culture
item.description: Australian tennis player Destanee Aiava says 2026 will be her last year in professional tennis, announcing her impending retirement in an expletive-laden statement on social media.

item.title: South Molle's damaged jetty restricts access to island, with abandoned resort's future unclear
item.description: South Molle Island's former resort has been abandoned since it was damaged by a cyclone in 2017. Now, public access to the island is restricted after Cyclone Koji wreaked havoc on its jetty.

item.title: Woodstock Farm program helping steer troubled Queensland youth away from life of crime
item.description: The rural-based social program in the shadow of Mt Tamborine has had remarkable success in rebuilding the lives of youth who have fallen through the cracks.

item.title: Faaletino Tavana scores stunning try in NRL trial, Canterbury Bulldogs star Matt Burton limps off
item.description: Wests Tigers rookie Faaletino Tavana has laid claim to one of the best tries in 2026 during a preseason trial against the Sydney Roosters.

item.title: Easy ways to help protect your hair from chlorine and saltwater damage
item.description: Regular beach days or laps at the local pool can leave our hair looking and feeling quite different.

item.title: Marco Rubio's speech to European allies takes softer tone but sticks to Trump's firm stance
item.description: America's top diplomat uses the Munich Security Conference to call for a renewed partnership between the United States and Europe, with Marco Rubio saying America and Europe "belong together".

item.description: The temporary loss of a pub is hitting residents of a country NSW town hard.

item.description: NSW Police say they pursued a red sedan after it was stolen from a man who was filling up his car at a petrol station.

item.title: Unscrupulous NDIS providers using inducements to recruit remote NT participants
item.description: People with disabilities in remote Northern Territory communities are being targeted by unscrupulous NDIS providers using high-pressure sales tactics and inducements including cash, cigarettes and alcohol, an ABC investigation can reveal.

item.description: The NT's small but mighty presence is shining on the global stage 40 years after Crocodile Dundee rocketed its film industry into the stratosphere.

item.title: Fortescue trials battery-electric locomotives in Pilbara as decarbonisation race tightens
item.description: After years of delays, the Pilbara's largest carbon emitters are testing greener ways to haul iron ore, and Andrew Forrest has now joined their ranks.

item.title: Italian migrants who brought 'fancy cheese' to Australia
item.description: When John Interlandi's father began making "fancy cheese" in Gippsland, few Australians had heard of parmesan. At 90 years old, Mr Interlandi is still perfecting it.

item.description: Winning Victoria coach Chris Scott and his Western Australia counterpart Dean Cox call for State of Origin to be played every year after the concept's stunning return in Perth.

item.title: NSW premier announces extra public holiday in April for Anzac Day
item.description: New South Wales has the fewest public holidays in Australia, observing only 11.

item.title: Supporting and connecting Deaf people, Olivia finds her calling more than just a job
item.description: Olivia Jackson, who lost her hearing as a child, has felt invisible for over a decade until she found her true calling to help other Deaf people achieve their goals as a support worker.

item.description: Local brewers are experimenting with new flavours, while some farms invest in US-made machinery to modernise and streamline the harvest process.

item.title: As Jakara Anthony dealt with her singles moguls crash, her coach worked out how to pick her back up
item.description: As Jakara Anthony dealt with the disappointment of her singles moguls crash, her coach Peter McNiel was working out how to pick her back up.

item.description: Gisèle Pelicot, the woman at the centre of France's largest rape trial, says she intends to visit her ex-husband in jail and look her abuser "straight in the eye" to get answers to other allegations under investigation.

item.description: A 27-year-old man has died in the Northern Territory after being stabbed during an armed fight with a 19-year-old, who has since been arrested.

item.description: Kal Glanznig had his urine tested as part of an upcoming documentary exploring plastic pollution in Australia. The results left him speechless.

item.description: Deputy Liberal leader Jane Hume says Australia needs to be "open minded" on nuclear power if the country is to bring down emissions and make power cheaper.

item.description: The South Australian and federal government release plans for the shipyard in Adelaide that will build at least eight nuclear-powered submarines under the AUKUS pact with the US and the UK.

item.title: From succession planning to inherited debt, there's pressure and joy in taking on a family business
item.description: Inheriting a family business comes with the weight of generations past. For these change-makers, the future is in modernising their operation and making it their own.

item.title: Obama deplores lack of shame after Trump shares monkey clip
item.description: Former US president Barack Obama has criticised a lack of shame and decorum in the country's political discourse, responding for the first time to a post on Donald Trump's social media account that depicted him and first lady Michelle as monkeys.

item.title: Statues of Amy Sherwin, Australia's first opera star, unveiled at Hobart's Hadley's Hotel in bid to cement legacy
item.description: An effort to bring new recognition to a Tasmanian opera star who became world famous, but who died poor, culminates in the unveiling of two statues of her in Hobart.

item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.description: A 52-year-old man has been charged and 'priceless' Egyptian artefacts have been recovered after a break-in at a small museum in Caboolture on Friday.

item.title: Indigenous side overturns 14-0 deficit to down Maori in women's All Stars
item.description: The Indigenous team overturns a 14-0 deficit to score a rousing comeback win over the Maori in the Women's All Stars clash.

item.title: Frog toxins used to poison Alexei Navalny the latest in long history of Russian chemical attacks
item.description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned by the Kremlin with a rare and lethal toxin found in the skin of poison dart frogs, five European countries have said. It's not the first time the country has been accused of poisoning its enemies.

item.title: Charlotte Mortlock quits Liberal Party following Sussan Ley leadership defeat
item.description: Women were less likely to vote for the Coalition at the 2025 election than ever before, according to the Australian Election Study.

item.description: The WA premier flags new legislation on hate speech and protests in a bid to protect "social cohesion" in the wake of "multiple threats across Australia" over the summer.

item.description: It went down to the final seconds, but the Indigenous and Maori NRL All Stars could not be separated with both sides left to rue missed chances after a 16-all draw.

item.description: Chinese skiing superstar Eileen Gu says she is "disappointed" and "saddened" that Winter Olympics organisers scheduled halfpipe training at the same time as her big air final at the MIlano Cortina Games.

item.description: Matt Graham's medal is the third Australia’s moguls squad has delivered at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.description: In 2002, Australia broke its Winter Olympics gold medal duck in the most extraordinary of ways, as Steven Bradbury put a decade of injury and bad luck behind him to claim the most thrilling of gold medals.

item.description: Is FAFO the 1980s parenting style today's generation of kids need, rebellion against gentle child-rearing, or exhausted parents just throwing their hands in the air?

item.description: Matt Graham's brilliant bronze in the dual moguls, and the incredible response from his teammates, proved to everyone that he is the true leader of this Winter Olympic squad.

item.title: Liberal Party divided over policy direction as Angus Taylor plots right-wing political shift
item.description: Angus Taylor says he will unite the Liberal Party, but a deeper rift is forming between those who want to overhaul the party's direction and those who believe doing so would mean political death.

item.description: The "case of the century" is set to play out in the federal court this month, with the ACCC taking on supermarket giant Coles for what it claims are "illusory" discounts.

item.description: A "potentially catastrophic" decline in Australia's childhood vaccination rates has contributed to the sharpest increase in cases of whooping cough in 35 years, infectious diseases experts say.

item.description: While the federal government considers an ambitious plan, a similar project in the UK has seen its fair share of controversies.

item.description: Australia slumps to a rain-affected 21-run loss to India in their opening T20 at the SCG, after selectors opted to drop vice-captain Tahlia McGrath.

item.description: India and Pakistan decline to shake hands before and after the most-anticipated game of the T20 World Cup, with India easily winning by 61 runs to secure its Super 8 spot.

item.description: Victorian farmers are forced to cart water or destock as dams and rivers run dry.

item.description: The FBI says a glove containing DNA was found near the home of US TV show host Savannah Guthrie's mother and appears to match those worn by a masked person outside her front door the night she vanished.

item.description: Adam Lambert's crash in the mixed snowboard cross cost Australia a chance at a medal at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games, but it still makes him feel better about his campaign.

item.title: Queensland school teacher calls for endometriosis support after fundraising for surgery
item.description: After years of unsuccessful endometriosis treatments, Inez Goves underwent a hysterectomy thanks to an online fundraiser. But her symptoms returned, prompting more surgery and calls for greater support for the illness.

item.title: Sydney scientist collects wild roadside apples to produce cider
item.description: Lucien Alperstein has spent the past decade picking feral apples from trees along country back roads and making cider. They say their guerilla activity inspired their curiosity about the science of genetics and fermentation.

item.description: Angus Taylor wrote to the prime minister pitching the plan just days after being elected leader of the Liberal Party.

item.description: They worship the riffs, rewrite the lyrics and win over the toughest crowds. GayC/DC is a tribute band like no other.

item.description: US President Donald Trump says the first meeting of his newly created Board of Peace will take place on Thursday, with over $7 billion to be pledged for reconstruction and humanitarian efforts in Gaza.

item.description: East Kimberley traditional owners are concerned Rio Tinto's closure plan will leave them with "a giant hole in the ground forever".

item.title: Vermilion's Wandoo gas exports halted after December oil spill
item.description: Exports from an oil field off WA's Pilbara are at a standstill after an oil spill in December. The regulator says it has identified "systemic failures" at the Canadian-owned Wandoo facility.

item.description: Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram, who is charged with 15 counts of murder, has appeared via video link for the first time in a Sydney court as a senior magistrate extended existing suppression orders in the case.

item.description: Detectives believe Chris Baghsarian was mistakenly snatched from his bedroom just after 5am on Friday by intruders who forced their way into his North Ryde property.

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.description: Miguel Simon Mungarrieta Monsalve has been charged with a range of offences after he allegedly broke into a Caboolture museum on Friday morning.

item.title: Maugean skate still faces 'catastrophic' risk from salmon farming, Commonwealth advice says
item.description: Official advice is unequivocal that salmon farming remains the main threat to the endangered Maugean skate. It remains to be seen if the federal environment minister will ask Tasmanian salmon farms to scale back their operations.

item.title: 'Signal sniffers' used in search for missing person Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker
item.description: The FBI is using "sophisticated" technology to try to locate Nancy Guthrie's pacemaker, as the search for the mother of US TV host Savannah Guthrie enters its third week.

item.title: Hospital boss says changes already made at child gender service criticised in review
item.description: Advocates have called for for better regional services after a Cairns children gender clinic was restricted following a scathing report.

item.title: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys fined almost $20,000 after leaving two divers in ocean
item.description: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys is fined almost $20,000 after an Australian Maritime Safety Authority probe found it took the crew on board 10 minutes to realise two divers had been left behind.

item.title: Firearms charges laid amid search for Gus Lamont, SA Police say unrelated to disappearance
item.description: Detectives investigating the case of missing boy Gus Lamont have made an arrest during their renewed search for evidence – but say it does not relate to his disappearance.

item.title: Heat, storms lead to extreme fire forecast across dry Victoria
item.description: Almost half the state is expected to face extreme fire conditions on Tuesday due to a mix of heat, dry fuels and gusty afternoon storms.

item.title: Protester takes to roof of Geraldton fisheries building over WA government's demersal fishing ban
item.description: A Geraldton fisherman locks himself to the roof of a government building — and says he has swallowed the key — in a protest over Cook government restrictions.

item.title: How cheating allegations have rocked the curling teams at the Olympics
item.description: Controversy is swirling in curling at the Winter Olympics after the Canadian team was accused of cheating. Here's a look at the whole controversy and why it matters.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 10
item.description: Find out what is on during Day 10 at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Raymond Reddington murder trial hears evidence of marriage breakdown between him and Sharon Fulton
item.description: A Perth court hears a woman who was allegedly murdered by her husband 40 years ago initiated separation proceedings in 1985, the year before she went missing.

item.title: ABC Radio Perth will move to 102.5FM from February 23
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Remote WA communities isolated and roads closed after weekend deluge
item.description: Major roads and remote communities are cut off by floodwaters after a deluge of rain in Western Australia's far north.

item.title: Canberra woman allegedly held captive for two days and raped was 'subdued with violence', court hears
item.description: A woman who fled naked into a Canberra street and told police she thought she was going to die had just escaped two days of alleged violent captivity, a jury has heard.

item.title: Stepson tells hearing terminally ill man 'wanted to be done' as wife committed to stand trial for his murder
item.description: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs has been committed to stand trial for the murder of her husband David Mobbs, who had motor neurone disease, after he was allegedly given a fatal dose of medication.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: CLP announces Anjan Paudel as Nightcliff by-election candidate, Phil Scott runs as independent
item.description: More candidates for the Nightcliff by-election are announced, with Phil Scott running as an independent and the Country Liberal Party preselecting Anjan Paudel, who has stumbled while answering basic policy questions.

item.title: Former FBI agents say looking closer at Nancy Guthrie's social circle may be key to finding her
item.description: As the FBI continues searching for kidnapped 84-year-old Nancy Guthrie in the United States, a former FBI negotiator says they will be focusing on the grandmother's social circle and family.

item.title: Aussie Walker finishes outside of medals at Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Australia's Bree Walker missed a spot on the podium but still managed a top-eight placing in the monobob at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Australian women and children with links to ISIS forced to head back to camp in Syria
item.description: A group of Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters are forced to turn around after leaving a camp in Syria to try and begin their journey home to Australia.

item.title: New Coalition leader Angus Taylor denies knowledge of Ley immigration policy
item.description: Opposition Leader Angus Taylor says he does not know anything about Sussan Ley's proposed immigration policy and that "more supply" is key to solving Australia's housing crisis.

item.title: 'Devastated' Australia on the brink of World Cup exit after Sri Lanka's record chase
item.description: Australia is on the cusp of a group stage exit from the T20 World Cup after crashing to an eight-wicket loss against tournament co-hosts Sri Lanka.

item.title: Kremlin rejects European accusations it poisoned Alexei Navalny with dart frog toxin
item.description: The Kremlin has rejected accusations from five European countries that the Russian state had killed late Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny two years ago using toxin from poison dart frogs.

item.title: The night snow came to Livigno, turning this surreal valley into an even greater paradise
item.description: Livigno is an Italian outlier in more ways than one. Already known for its special tax status and fairytale quality, the town has had a phenomenal dumping of snow, causing a significant shuffling of events.

item.title: North Korea builds homes for families of soldiers killed fighting in Ukraine
item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un unveils new housing development in the country's capital, Pyongyang, to repay the "young martyrs" killed fighting in Ukraine.

item.title: Today in History, February 17: 20 years since The Chaser's War on Everything premiered
item.description: The Chaser's War on Everything didn't start the fire, but the embers from the beloved satirical current affairs show are still warm after two decades.

item.title: Ukrainian ex-minister Herman Halushchenko accused of stashing laundered millions offshore
item.description: Ukraine's anti-corruption police have accused its ex-energy minister of helping launder kickbacks and stashing millions offshore, a day after he was detained trying to leave the country.

item.title: Angus Taylor bets on migration politics amid global rightward shift
item.description: If migration is treated primarily as a cultural fault line, rather than an economic system embedded in national growth, the debate will remain loud. The structural reform will remain unfinished.

item.title: Victorian Greens call for broadened powers of state's anti-corruption body in wake of CMFEU scandal
item.description: The Victorian Greens are calling for broadened powers of the state's anti-corruption body after the watchdog confirmed it rejected a request by the premier for an investigation into the CFMEU scandal because it was out of scope.

item.title: Robert Duvall, star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95
item.description: Oscar winner Robert Duvall, known for films such as The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95.

item.title: How to decide what type of car insurance is best for you
item.description: Choosing the right car insurance option can feel daunting, but it's the kind of task that it pays to get right. So, how can you decide which type is most suitable for you?

item.title: Results show high levels of lead contamination in dust around Hobart, as EPA flags further tests
item.description: High levels of lead contamination have been found in dust samples taken from suburban locations close to Nyrstar's Hobart zinc smelter, documents obtained by the ABC show.

item.title: Tradies consider leaving careers over lack of onsite toilets
item.description: Tradies are walking out. Not over ability or aptitude but toilets — in a symbol of the sector's persistent barriers.

item.title: Interest rate hike worries? Here's some good news
item.description: Fresh warnings of further rate rises have been enough to send shivers up the collective spine of new homeowners, but if there's any comfort to be had, it's this: Don't believe a word of the forecasts.

item.title: Anti-slavery commissioner calls for tougher laws amid forced labour concerns for Ansell and Kmart
item.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner calls for tough new laws forcing companies to take slavery in their supply chains seriously, as Ansell and Kmart face scrutiny.

item.title: Carlton's Jacob Weitering suffers rib fracture after AFL State of Origin, but cleared of other injuries
item.description: Carlton star Jacob Weitering has received some good news, with the Blues labelling their injured vice-captain as a "good chance" to feature in opening round.

item.title: Iran's state TV airs 'forced confessions' of 'scapegoats' whose families fear could face execution
item.description: Families of Baha'i youth arrested by Iran's security forces say they've been subject to "forced confessions" and fear they may face the death penalty.

item.title: Resource to help 'invisible' victim-survivors of sexual abuse — older women
item.description: Experts say sexual violence against older women is "grossly underestimated" as victim-survivors face additional barriers to disclosing the abuse.

item.title: Victorian Indigenous community elects two directors to MDAS despite court action
item.description: An Aboriginal organisation in Victoria's north-west elects its new board in a re-run of its general meeting, which resulted in two of the elected directors fighting the service in the court.

item.title: News quiz: Year of the Horse traditions, zodiac facts and festive customs across Asia
item.description: How much do you know about the Year of the Horse and unique Lunar New Year traditions in Asian countries? Put your knowledge to the test with these 10 questions and see if you're a true Lunar New Year expert!

item.title: Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board suing Melissa Oates for $934k in damages over Jari Wise's death
item.description: A woman who hit and killed her partner with her car in 2020 is being pursued for almost $1 million in damages by the Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board.

item.title: How these 'old-school' Chinese restaurants in Melbourne have survived for decades
item.description: Since the early 90s, these Chinese restaurateurs have served the community they call "family". This is how they've stayed open amid Melbourne's ever-changing food culture.

item.title: Irish rugby to investigate racial abuse towards Test debutant Edwin Edogbo
item.description: The Irish Rugby Football Union has said it will launch an investigation after turning comments off a social media post that congratulated the country's newest Test debutant.

item.title: Silverstream Labradors under scrutiny after 200 dogs found on site
item.description: The breeder's puppies were once featured on Kleenex commercials but it is now under scrutiny from the RSPCA and other pet organisations.

item.title: Are flood zone houses being swept up in Brisbane's property boom?
item.description: The river city is now the second-most expensive capital in Australia to buy a house in, but many properties also face flood risks.

item.title: Police likely looking for motive during renewed search for Gus Lamont, retired detective says
item.description: Police are again at remote Oak Park Station searching for evidence related to the disappearance of missing four-year-old Gus Lamont, with a retired police officer saying detectives are likely "looking for a motive".

item.title: Mould, asbestos, collapsed ceilings plague some South Australian schools
item.description: Almost two years after a state government report revealed 35 per cent of all buildings within the Department for Education's portfolio were past their design life, many schools are still plagued with issues including mould, asbestos and rotting windows.

item.title: The Carters and Sartoris mark 70 years of marriage and 70 years as next-door neighbours
item.description: A month after Ron and June Carter got married and moved in together, his sister got married and moved in next door. This year marks not just 70 years of marriage for both couples, but 70 years of being next-door neighbours.

item.title: Live: Angus Taylor distances himself from Ley immigration policy
item.description: Opposition Leader Angus Taylor has denied knowledge of an immigration policy that was looking to ban people coming to Australia from terror-declared areas. Follow live.

item.title: What we know about the IS-linked families who want to return to Australia
item.description: Australia has made limited progress in clearing a passage for the Australian women and their children, citing safety issues in and around the camps, and security concerns back home.

item.title: Live: BHP lifts profit and dividend as it strikes silver deal
item.description: The Australian share market is set to open higher as investors await half-yearly company results. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Juanella Donovan reflects on People's Choice win at National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards
item.description: Juanella Donovan has taken out the People's Choice category at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards for the second time, emerging as the public favourite from more than 200 entries across the country.

item.title: Live: Ex-footballer shot multiple times in Western Sydney drive-by shooting
item.description: Police have been told Matt Utai, who played for the Tigers and Bulldogs NRL clubs, was shot outside a home on the street by the occupants of an SUV, before they fled the scene.

item.title: Batchelor's main store and only post office to reopen amid town's revival
item.description: For the past year, Batchelor's residents have had to drive to the next town or an hour to Darwin to collect mail or buy food. It marked a low point in a rough period, but a year on the town is beginning to claw its way back.

item.title: Reducing run-off from macadamia farms improves soil but more needed to boost waterways
item.description: A new study backs up the agricultural and environmental benefits of certain macadamia farming practices, but the industry says there is still a long way to go in improving waterway health.

item.title: Illegal fishing vessels threaten Australia's agricultural sector as biosecurity concerns grow
item.description: Australian primary producers say they are concerned about the risk of foreign pests crippling entire industries if overseas fishing boats continue to enter the nation's waters illegally.

item.title: Central to Defence Working Group outlines pitch for larger Defence presence in central Queensland
item.description: Three central Queensland councils are trying to entice the Australian Defence Force to invest in the region, in the hopes of a defence economy boom.

item.title: A waterfall gushes at Python Pool in WA's Pilbara region.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bushwalkers soak in near 'once-in-a-lifetime' waterfall after cyclone in WA's Pilbara
item.description: The question of whether there is water in Python Pool is often asked around the pubs and message boards of WA's Pilbara. For the moment, the answer is very much yes.

item.title: Own goal ends Macclesfield's FA Cup fairytale against Brentford
item.description: Non-league English football club Macclesfield's tremendous FA Cup run has come to an end, falling to Premier League side Brentford.

item.title: Pod Save America and why Australians remain obssessed with US politics
item.description: Huge crowds have flocked to live shows for the popular and influential Pod Save America podcast, suggesting Australia's obsession with US politics isn't going away anytime soon.

item.title: Cousin pleads with Sydney man Chris Baghsarian's abductors for release
item.description: The cousin of Sydney man Chris Baghsarian, who was abducted in a case of mistaken identity four days ago, says he is praying for the 85-year-old's safe return.

item.title: PM will not repatriate Australians with IS links in Syria
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Highly sensitive Australian court data accessed by foreign entity based in India
item.description: Highly sensitive Australian court files have been accessed offshore in breach of the privacy act and Commonwealth contractual obligations, an ABC investigation has revealed, raising concerns of a national security risk.

item.title: Australia leads the world in moguls skiing. This is the reason why
item.description: To the surprise of many, the "beach nation" that is Australia is the best moguls skiing nation on earth. How they got there is no accident.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Eileen Gu medals despite blizzard, Ilia Malinin breaks his silence — day 10 quick hits
item.description: A Norwegian skier melts down in the Italian cold as the Canadian women's curling team hits back at cheating accusations. Here are the quick hits from day 10 of the Milano Cortina Winter Games.

item.title: Emu raids on Nannup's rubbish tip spark growing concerns for mob's health
item.description: Emus raiding Nannup's rubbish tip are ending up with rotisserie chicken bags and piping stuck around their necks.

item.title: Austrian man faces terror charges over Taylor Swift concert plot
item.description: Austrian prosecutors have filed terrorism-related charges against a 21-year-old man who they say planned to carry out an Islamist militant attack at one of Taylor Swift's 2024 concerts in Vienna.

item.title: Schools without working toilets and road damaged after burst water main in Brisbane's east
item.description: Homes and a local school are without water and a key arterial road is damaged after a pipe burst on Monday.
